conclusion: Analyze paths of liquids from points A, B, C, and D.
Liquid from Point A flows downward and encounters a yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point A moves left and flows downward towards container E.
Liquid from Point B flows downward and encounters the same yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point B moves left and flows downward into container E.
Liquid from Point C flows downward and encounters the yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point C moves left and flows downward into container E.
Liquid from Point D flows downward and encounters a yellow baffle.
Liquid from Point D moves right and flows downward into container F.
Liquids from points A, B, and C will flow into container E.
Liquid from point D will flow into container F.
Container E will receive the liquids from A, B, and C.
Container F will receive the liquid from D.
